meanings.definition: To soar higher or more impressively than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The eagle tried to outsoar the hawk in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The champion athlete managed to outsoar all his competitors in the long jump.
meanings.sent3: The little bird challenged the big bird to a race to see who could outsoar the other.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams would outsoar any obstacle that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The kite seemed to outsoar the clouds, reaching for the sun.

meanings.definition: To surpass in flying or soaring.
meanings.sent1: The jet plane could easily outsoar the small propeller plane.
meanings.sent2: The falcon's ability to outsoar its prey ensured a successful hunt.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape allowed him to outsoar any bird in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed would outsoar any doubts or fears.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon would outsoar any other floating object in the sky.

meanings.definition: To fly or soar beyond a certain point or limit.
meanings.sent1: The rocket was designed to outsoar the Earth's atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The hang glider hoped to outsoar the highest peak in the mountain range.
meanings.sent3: The paper airplane unexpectedly managed to outsoar the toy drone.
meanings.sent4: His imagination would outsoar the boundaries of reality.
meanings.sent5: The eagle's majestic wings allowed it to outsoar any other bird in the forest.
